metadata.title: CVE-2019-19770 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** In the Linux kernel 4.19.83, there is a use-after-free(read) in the debugfs_remove function in fs/debugfs/inode.c (which is usedto remove a file or directory in debugfs that was previously created with acall to another debugfs function such as debugfs_create_file). NOTE: Linuxkernel developers dispute this issue as not being an issue with debugfs,instead this is an issue with misuse of debugfs within blktrace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19770` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1077-gke - 4.15.0-1077.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1077-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1077.82
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1094-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1094.103
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1027-gke - 5.4.0-1027.28~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1003-gkeop - 5.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1010-dell300x - 4.15.0-1010.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-129.132').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needed').
